title: File, Process and Memory System Calls
description: Implementation of various system calls for file operations and process management in Unix/Linux environments.

title: Deadlock avoidance and detection
description: Implementation of deadlock avoidance and detection algorithms in a multi-threaded environment.

title: Process Synchronization
description: Implementation of process synchronization problems: Producer-Consumer, Readers-Writers, Dining-Philosophers and Cigarette-Smokers.

title: Memory Management
description: Implementation of MFT and MVT algorithms.

title: Memory Management Unit
description: Simulation of address translation using MMU.

title: Disk Scheduling Algorithms
description: Implementation of disk scheduling algorithms: FCFS, SSTF, SCAN, C-SCAN, LOOK, C-LOOK.

title: Memory allocation
description: Implementation of memory allocation algorithms: First Fit, Best Fit, Worst Fit, Quick Fit, Buddy Fit etc.

title: Page Replacement Algorithms
description: Implementation of page replacement algorithms: FIFO, LRU, LFU, Optimal.

title: Completely Fair Scheduler
description: Simulation of the Linux Completely Fair Scheduler (CFS) using nice values to control CPU time allocation among processes.

title: Nice Value Priority Simulator
description: A visual and interactive simulation demonstrating the concept of process scheduling using nice values, inspired by the Completely Fair Scheduler in Linux.

title: Interprocess Communication
description: A visual and interactive simulation demonstrating the concept of process scheduling using nice values, inspired by the Completely Fair Scheduler in Linux.
